SENT.plain: The authors report 33 observations concerning benign intracranial hypertension in 4 months to 15 year-old children
They emphasize the prevalence of this syndrome and the frequent absence of papilloedema at this age period
CCT scan is the neuroradiologic procedure of choice to exclude an intracranial lesion
It is important to note the exceptional evolution to a secondary optic atrophy
